alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 6:09PM MST until July 20 at 8:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR THE PRESCOTT VALLEY AREA IN YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 607 PM MST, local law enforcement reported flooding along portions of Lakeshore Drive in Prescott Valley. Other areas of flooding are likely mainly south of Highway 89A in Prescott Valley. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell earlier this afternoon, but heavy rain has ended at this time. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Prescott Valley. This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 282 and 288. State Route 89A between mile markers 323 and 324. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Agua Fria River, Coyote Wash, Lynx Creek and Winters Wash. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
